.
Preparing the Final Rating Decision Codesheet in Cases Involving Severance of SC
When severing SC due to CUE, update the
Codesheet
so that it reads how it should have read had no error been made.
Include in the combined SC evaluation only those evaluations for disabilities that remain SC.
The severed condition should be shown on the
Codesheet
as an issue for which SC has been denied (if that is the determination that would have been made had the error resulting in severance not occurred).  This may require manual adjustment of the master record.
This will ensure that no retroactive increase or benefit attributable to the severed disability will be awarded after basic entitlement is terminated.
Exception
:  When severance of SC results in the discontinuation of all compensation (no SC disabilities or only noncompensable SC disabilities remain),
do not
update the
Codesheet
so that it reads how it should have read had no error been made.  Instead, follow the procedures provided in the interim guidance document titled
SOP for CUE Severance Award Processing
.
References
:  For more information on
the effective date of the change in compensation following the severance of SC of one or more disabilities, see
38 CFR 3.105(d)
38 CFR 3.500(r)
, and
M21-1, Part X, Subpart ii, 5.C
, and
instructions for generating a final severance rating, see the
VBMS Rating User Guide
.
